Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of an undetermined motif, possibly part of a draped female figure with added white for flesh.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski suggests a comparison with Agora P 4549 (Moore, Agora XXX (1979) 213-214 no. 509 pl. 55, dated 375BC - 350BC
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.44 no. C 28 pl. 17.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1178)
